The first two terms of an infinite geometric sequence are $u_1 = 20$ and $u_2 = 16\sin^2 \theta$, where $\text{\(0 < \theta < 2\pi\)}$, and $\theta \neq \pi$.

1. 1. Find an expression for $r$ in terms of $\theta$.
   2. Find the possible values of $r$. [5]
2. Show that the sum of the infinite sequence is
   $\dfrac{100}{3 + 2\cos 2\theta}$.
   [4]
3. Find the values of $\theta$ which give the greatest value of the
   sum. [6]
